questions.question_text:
An administrator is configuring two FortiGate devices in an HA cluster. While configuring the devices, the administrator issues the following commands on both HA cluster members:

config system ha
set link-failed-signal enable

In which two ways do these commands impact the HA cluster? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct
In most networks, thatâ€™s enough for the switches to update their MAC forwarding tables with the new information.
However, some high-end switches might not clear their MAC tables correctly after a failover. So, they keep
sending packets to the former primary even after receiving the gratuitous ARPs. In these cases, you should use
the command shown on this slide to force the former primary to shut down all its interfaces for one second when
the failover happens, excluding heartbeat and reserved management interfaces. This simulates a link failure that
clears the related entries from the MAC table of the switches.

Selected Answer: BD
BD
Pg 98 study guide

Selected Answer: AD
This command forces the former primary to shut its interfaces for 1 second following an HA failover resulting in the switches updating their MAC address tables.

choices.D: They force the former primary to shut down all its interfaces for one second when failover happens, excluding the heartbeat and reserved management interfaces.
choices.C: They force both HA devices for remote link monitoring to detect an issue in the forwarding path.
choices.A: They force the switches to update their MAC forwarding tables, when failover happens.
choices.B: They force the former primary to send gratuitous ARP packets when the failover happens to indicate that the virtual MAC address is now using a different device.

choices.D: The administrator must reconfigure the heartbeat interface.
choices.A: The administrator must reconfigure the monitor interface.
choices.B: The administrator must reconfigure the cluster in active-active mode.
choices.C: The administrator must reconfigure the cluster in FGSP mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.


Network topology -

//IMG//


Output from the command config system ha

//IMG//


A network diagram and the output from the command config system ha are shown.

The administrator has configured the cluster with the commands shown in the exhibit.

Why is the HA cluster not forming?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
7.2 Study Guide page 317
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
FEC adds additional redundant packets to the IPSEC tunnel for reassembly of data in the event of packet loss.

choices.D: FortiGate will add additional redundant information to reconstruct any lost or erratically received packets.
choices.A: FortiGate will consider all IKEv2 packets as fragmentable.
choices.C: If fragmentation occurs, FortiGate will allow the packets at the IKE layer.
choices.B: When an FGSP member in FortiGate fails, FortiGate flushes the corresponding tunnels and sends out dead peer detection probes to find unavailable remote peers.

questions.question_text: How would fec-ingress and fec-egress IPsec configuration affect an IPsec tunnel?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A, Get Hardware Status command shows ASIC Version with CP model.

Selected Answer: A
Study Guide EFW7.2 pg 57: to determine the cp model available on Fortigate # get hardware status

Selected Answer: A
get hardware status

questions.question_text:
You want to know which content processor (CP) model FortiGate contains.

Which command should you enter?

An administrator must optimize the performance of real-time voice and video applications across a WAN link with high packet loss.

Which combination of IPSec phase 1 parameters must the administrator configure to reduce errors and boost application reliability?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A, IPSEC Chapter talks about FEC being a phase 1 setting that adds additional packets with redundant data. FEC is critical for delivering a better user experience for business critical applications like voice and video services
